channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for FL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for FL

item.title: Report E-2023040077
item.description:
Report E-2023040077

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-09T15:09:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-03
  • City: ALACHUA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On April 3, 2023, at 1015 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar Ranger personnel in Alachua, Florida regarding the release of approximately 1 gallon of Eco-San (Hypochlorite solutions, UN1791 8, III) and approximately 8 gallons of Ultra-San (Hypochlorite solutions, UN1791 8, III). The releases were reportedly due to leaks in the product containers. The release was contained to the trailer floor. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release using absorbents and the proper PPE. The released products, spent absorbents and all other waste generated were containerized in (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste drums were then transported off site for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023031125
item.description:
Report X-2023031125

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-09T15:09:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-01
  • City: LONGWOOD
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: spilldevgrp@fedex.com
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The shipment was discovered to be leaking while on the road by the courier. It was brought back to the station and brought to the attention of the manager. There were no hazard labels or markings on the outside of the package, however there were GHS labels that led DG Admin to research the product to verify if it was a dangerous good. DG Admin received an email from the manufacturer that contained the SDS for the product and it confirmed that it is UN3082 Environmentally Hazardous Substance, liquid, 9, PGIII. Each inner container is greater than 5kg. DG Admin advised the station to place the drum into a salvage drum and to hold until further notice.

item.title: Report X-2023030979
item.description:
Report X-2023030979

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-09T15:09:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-15
  • City: DAVENPORT
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023030979 SequenceEvent: Package was being unloaded on vanline 9. While in transit a 6 hazmat packages were all wet and leaking. They were all the same type of box and item. None of them were dropped or broken package wise. Entire vanline 9 was shut down until the leakage was cleaned. DescribePack: Upon inspection no damage was done to the box. While taking more of look inside packages seem to be leaking from the seams of the plastic jugs. While others had more of loose caps during transit. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Leaking package was placed in a hazmat tote until hazmat personnel arrived for inspection. 2. X-2023030985 SequenceEvent: Package was being unloaded on vanline 9. While in transit a 6 hazmat packages were all wet and leaking. They were all the same type of box and item. None of them were dropped or broken package wise. Entire vanline 9 was shut down until the leakage was cleaned. DescribePack: Upon inspection no damage was done to the box. While taking more of look inside packages seem to be leaking from the seams of the plastic jugs. While others had more of loose caps during transit. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Leaking package was placed in a hazmat tote until hazmat personnel arrived for inspection.

X-2023030917: PACKAGE INSPECTION WAS DONE DUE TO PREVIOUS HISTORY OF UNDECLARED SHIPMENTS FROM THE CUSTOMER.   • Carrier/Reporter: spilldevgrp@fedex.com
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The HSTA station received a plastic jerrican that was inside of a plastic bag with yellow absorbent pads taped to the bottom of the package. It did not appear to be leaking when they first received it, however the next day when it was moved there was a small amount of the contents leaked out of the plastic bag. The package contained UN1197 Extracts, flavoring, 3, PGII, and DG Admin advised the station to place in a salvage drum and to call the recipient to come and pick it up.

DescribePack: Upon inspection inside the packaging the 4 bottles were bagged up but not tight enough and causing the caps of the bottles to come loose during transit which the loose cap is what caused the spillage. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a hazmat container and the small spill the package did cause was cleaned up.

item.title: Report E-2023030786
item.description:
Report E-2023030786

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-09T15:09:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-24
  • City: HUDSON
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Alpha-Omega Training and Compliance (AOTC) was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 4ft-by-5ft area of the trailer floor, a 3ft-by-1ft area of asphalt roadway, and a 10ft-by-8ft area of soil alongside the roadway and estimated that one hundred (100) gallons of material was released. AOTC personnel stated that the cause of the release was due to a strap that punctured the poly tote. The remaining material in the damaged tote, approximately 165 gallons, was transferred to a new tote and placed back into the trailer along with the empty damaged tote to be shipped on to the consignee. AOTC personnel deployed granular absorbents to the trailer floor and the asphalt roadway and worked them into the impacted areas. The spent absorbents inside the trailer were swept out onto the roadway and then swept into the impacted soil to be collected when the remediation of the impacted soil is scheduled at a later date. No waste was generated in this emergency response.

  • Description: On February 28, 2023, one (1) 15-gallon drum of UN1263 was damaged due to a load shift and released approximately one and a half (1.5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted surface. HES personnel utilized granular absorbents and hand tools to collect and containerize all UN1263-impacted material and the damaged drum into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Manager advised me there was a burning liquid on several boxes from an unknown source during the sort. Shortly after, the box was located at the overhead belts up above the dock. It was an unmarked box leaking badly. Once a SDS was found for its product, it was put into the HazMat Cage within a HazMat bag and red tote. DescribePack: The box was soaked and the bottom had come open. One cap was loose and leaked 3/4th of a gallon out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The product's SDS was found online and it was taken away using a HazMat bag and red tote. Maintenance technicians used rags to clean up the spill, which also went with the salvage drum after processing.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-08T21:09:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-15
  • City: Miami
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES GROUP INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During loading of baggage for Flight 1491 in Miami to Holguin, Cuba, a connecting bag from flight 3240 IAH-MIA was noticed to be Ieaking a black liquid that smelled strongly of Iacquer paint. Upon removal and investigation of the contents of the customefs bag it was discovered an aerosol can of Raptor 1 K Pro Roll Bar and Chassis Paint had discharged into the bag. There was no cap on the aerosol can and the valve had come into contact with a hard point on the interior of the bag depressing the valve and causing it to discharge its contents. Flight 1491 was delayed 161 minutes for cleanup and investigation inconveniencing 97 customers.

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-14
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: AmeriGas Propane LP
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 04:51 am - Employee noticed a liquid leak coming from between the flange of the storage tank and the gauge. he notified manager immediately and operations were shut down. 05:17 am - Manager reached out to safety department for further instructions and the tank was locked out and tagged out in the meantime.Liquid stopped leaking from the tank and there was a slight vapor leak. 8:15 am - Once deemed safe to operate, other tanks were closed and the tank with the leak was opened so that the tank could be emptied of liquid propane Tank emptied out within two days and locked out. All remaining propane was flared off after Miami-Dade FD approved prior to repair and remained locket out. 2/9/2023 - The gauge and gasket were replaced and the investigation was finalized.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO DOOR 67 FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE ON THE GRATING. AFTER APPROACHING PACKAGE AND OPENING TO DISCOVER THE CONTENTS, A FIVE GALLON BUCKET WITH DIAMOND HAZARD LABELS WAS DISCOVERED. THE OUTER PACKAGING HAD NO LABELS TO DECLARE THE HAZARDOUS MATERIAL INSIDE AND THE SDS ATTACHED TO THE INTERIOR BUCKET SHOWED THE DOT REGULATIONS FOR ITS TRANSPORTATION. RMP WAS NOTIFIED AND THE HAZMAT HELP LINE WAS CALLED TO REPORT THE SUSPECTED UNDECLARED HAZMAT. THE PACKAGE WAS CONFIRMED UNDECLARED AT WHICH POINT IT WAS BROUGHT BACK TO THE DMP CAGE FOR SIX-SIDED PICTURES AND INTERIOR CONTENT PICTURES TO BE SENT TO ADG.

item.description:
Report E-2023010288

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-08T21:09:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-18
  • City: JACKSONVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 1-18-23 at 1130 personnel in the CSXT Edgewood Yard discovered GATX200407, a loaded tank car of Crude Sulfate Turpentine leaking vapors from the manway. The car was isolated and Georgia Pacific/Leaf River Cellulose were notified (CHEMTREC Report #2023011800157). Hepaco LLC, a CSXT response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the vapors were being released from the manway. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper Tom Davidson and 404-376-9550. Contractor personnel opened manway and found that gasket was damaged, Hepaco installed a new manway gasket and tool tightened manway safety bolts. The leak was secured and the car released for transport. This incident did not require a special switching move.

item.title: Report E-2023010287
item.description:
Report E-2023010287

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-08T21:09:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-16
  • City: ORLANDO
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO terminal NOF reported a release of 3-gallons of "ProClean Foaming Acid" (UN3264) due to a forklift accident on the dock. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released to the dock floor in a 10' x 15' area of the dock floor due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area and then collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

Upon discovery, it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin and brought over to damages for further processing and containment. DescribePack: One side of the outer packaging was heavily stained and corroded away. The inner partition inside was corroded all the way through, and some of the inner walls were stained. The contents were all stained, and one appeared to be leaking slightly from a loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: There were no effects found. Upon discovery, the package was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment.

  • Description: Driver arrived at customer and contacted operator per instructions. All primary tanks were full. Customer had driver move to different location for reserve tank. Driver asked customer for confirmation that load will fit Customer signed Delmo. No visible indication on tank,all levels are monitored at control room. Tank was solid white so could not see level. Driver asked customer again if it would fit and was told yes. Driver continued to unload trailer. 15 mins later tank over flowed. Driver reported it to operator and was told their gauge was only showing 90%. Customer cleaned up the overfill

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazmat box was put into overhead sortation. The bottom flaps opened during sortation, spilling the 4 jugs inside onto the sorters. DescribePack: The caps on 2 of the jugs came off, causing 1 jug to leak contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box with the 2 unopened jugs were brought to QA to wait for the other jugs to be found. The 2 jugs were later found damaged under the sorters. They were bagged, and all were brought to the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report E-2022120523
item.description:
Report E-2022120523

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-08T21:09:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-14
  • City: APOPKA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 1039 EST - ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics domicile terminal NOF regarding a release of UN1133 Everstrong ES 700 from a 5-gallon metal pail. The spill location occurred over the road at 2717 Pemberton Dr. in Apopka, FL. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 1' x 1' area of the trailer floor and asphalt lot below due to a puncture. Absorbents were worked into the impacted areas and collected along with the damaged pail, and all cleanup debris into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was removed from site for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2022120518
item.description:
Report E-2022120518

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-08T21:09:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-11
  • City: ORLANDO
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 2351 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal NOF. It was reported that approximately 15 gallons of an unknown UN1590, 6.1, III was released from a 55-gallon plastic drum due to the drum being punctured by a forklift blade. The release impacted the concrete dock floor. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 25-gallons of Bare Metal Stripper released to an 18' x 21' area of the dock floor due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged drum was containerized into an 85-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2022120517
item.description:
Report E-2022120517

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-08T21:09:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-14
  • City: HIALEAH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0959 ET, XPO Logistics terminal NMF contacted ERTS to report a spill in Hialeah, FL. XPO advised that when a driver attempted to move a pallet containing a 15 gallon poly drum of Ecolab bleach he punctured the bottom of the drum causing a 5-gallon release. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 15-gallons of product released to the trailer floor in a 5' x 3' area due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were worked into the impacted area and collected. The damaged drum, broken pallet, and spent absorbents were then placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report I-2022120287
item.description:
Report I-2022120287

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-08T21:09:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-16
  • City: Miami
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES GROUP INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 16, 2021 at approximately 14:45 PM, a High Energy(H/E)(potential thermal runaway) condition occurred on flight 1574 outbound from Kingston, Jan=^aica(KIN), inbound to Miami, Florida(MIA). The event took place during cruising altitude and during main cabin service. The event was approximately an hour prior to landing, putting the event at approximately 14:45 pm to 15:00 pm. I, Flight Attendant#1 received a call from the back galley by FA#2. She notified me of a passenger who had a vaping device near the back of the plane, who complained to her that the device was becoming extremely hot in their pocket. The passenger was identified as a Mr. Kenneth Steven Snell, seat number 29E. FA asked if we should use the fire containment bag, and I agreed that would be best to contain the H/E condition being omitted by the vape device. In this report there was a question for what occurred (Fire, Fumes/Odor, or smoke), there was no option for H/E conditions so I selected smoke, however, no smoke came from the device. The event was only a High Energy condition A event(overheating but no smoke or fire). The fire containment bag was delivered to the FAs in the back galley to treat and contain the over heating vape device. The bag was then stored in an empty cart in the back galley and monitored by FA 2,3 and 4. The Captain was notified immediately after the fire containment bag was donned. No escalating conditions occurred during flight. Upon arrival at Miami international airport, the gate agent's were immediately notified and a flight service manager came onboard to get a report of the event. Upon all passengers deplaning, the fire containment bag was removed by the flight services manager for record and documentation. Request for new equipment was placed for the aircraft as well. The vaping product was an"MBox vape" by Athena Vapors. Item was cool to the touch after being treated and contained. No other incidents and no injuries occurred in this event. END OF REPORT.

  • Description: Our driver pulled up to the plant and the gate was locked. He called dispatch and an operator from the plant called him with the code to the gate. Driver pulled in and got hooked up and he spoke with the operator again and asked about the level in the tank. The clock gauge is not accurate and the audible overfill alarm had been removed. They had an electronic reading in the office but no one was on site. The operator told our driver over the phone that the tank reading was at 45% and it would fit. Due to a hurricane, The site had ordered too much fuel because they had pulled their trucks off the road and did not use what they normally do. The operator did not take this into account when he told our driver it would fit. Shield Engineering managed the cleanup. Product was contained to AST pad.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 23, 2022, one (1) 55-gallon drum of sodium hypochlorite (UN1791) toppled during transit and released approximately fifty (50) gallons of product to the trailer interior and concrete surfaces below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental and Emergency Services (E3) to complete the necessary remediation. E3 personnel utilized a pressure washer until all UN1791 was washed away. All UN1791-impacted material was collected in one (1) 85-gallon overpack for later transport and disposal.

UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERD THREE PACKAGES TO CONTAIN FLAMMABLE MEDI-FIRST AEROSOL BLOOD CLOTTING SPRAY. TRACKING NUMBERS 1Z36AW340394583347, 1Z36AW340391445331 AND 1Z36AW340392925356 EACH CONTAINED (96) AEROSOL CANS OF MEDI-FIRST BLOOD CLOTTING SPRAY. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THESE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 36AW34, GREENGUARD-MEDIQUE LOC 415, 17080 ALICO COMMERCE CT., FORT MYERS FL 33967.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-17
  • City: JACKSONVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LIQUID CARGO INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 17, 2022, at 1120 ET, Liquid Cargo reported 20-gallons ofUN3082 "ISO E SUPER" from a 2400-liter ISO container, impacting soil suspected to be due to container overfill. ERTS dispatched Alpha-Omega Training and Compliance (AOTC) to the site to conduct all onsite clean up operations. AOTC arrived on-site and advised that 25 to 30-gallons of product released into a containment pool and soils. AOCT determined the tank body jacket was leaking in three locations. A material transfer was completed in order to conduct a proper pressure test of the ISO container. AOTC completed the line flushing test on the lines and material transfer. AOTC collected and containerized (1) 55-gallon drum of liquids (deconning fluids from hoses and pump) and (1) 55-gallon steel drum of impacted absorbents and soil.

item.title: Report E-2022090393
item.description:
Report E-2022090393

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-08T21:09:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-08
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN MIAMI, FLORIDA, A BLACK SHRINK WRAPPED PALLET DESTINED FOR GUATEMALA HAD ORIENTATION ARROWS ON THE OUTER BLACK SHRINK WRAP, BUT THE ARROWS WERE IN AN INCORRECT SIDEWAY ORIENTATION. UNCOVERING THE BLACK SHRINK WRAP REVEALED 15 BOXES WITH GREEN CERTIFIED MAIL STICKERS THAT APPEARED TO BE COVERING MARKS OR LABELS ORIGINALLY IN A DIAMOND SHAPE. UNCOVERING THE GREEN STICKERS REVEALED GROUND LTD QTY MARKS ON ALL 15 BOXES. OPENED PACKAGES AND FOUND FLAMMABLE AEROSOL CANS OF ANDIS COOL CARE PLUS FOR CLIPPER BLADES (UN1950 AEROSOLS FLAMMABLE). INSPECTION OF ALL ADDITIONAL PACKAGES OF THE CARGO FOUND ADDITIONAL BOXES WITH COVERED UN3481 LITHIUM BATTERY MARKS. SOME BOXES HAD THE APPEARANCE OF MARKS/LABELS BEING CUT FROM THE OUTER AND INNER BOXES. ONE UNMARKED BOX CONTAINED SIX INNER BOXES WITH 20 PHONES IN EACH BOX, EQUALING 120 PHONES. ONE UNMARKED BOX CONTAINED 50 CELL PHONES INSIDE. ONE UNMARKED BOX CONTAINED ANOTHER 20 CELL PHONES INSIDE. ONE PACKAGE WAS MARKED INSIDE THE PALLET WITH A UN3480 LITHIUM BATTERY MARK AND CONTAINED LAPTOP BATERIES ALONE. THIS MARK WAS NOT VISIBLE. SEVERAL INNER BOXES CONTAINING BABYBYLISSPRO TRIMMERS AND WAHL DETAILERS POWERED BY RECHARGEABLE LITHIUM ION BATTERIES, SOME WITH UN3481 MARKINGS INSIDE THE UNMARKED BOXES. THERE IS NO DANGEROUS GOODS PAPERWORK OR INDICATION ON THE AIR WAYBILL OR ON THE OUTER BLACK SHRINK WRAP THAT DANGEROUS GOODS WERE BEING SHIPPED TO GUATEMALA.

item.title: Report X-2022090855
item.description:
Report X-2022090855

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-08T21:09:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-21
  • City: COCOA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: FedEx repack box 15x12x15 cut down to between 6-8in height. 4 32fl oz ready-to-spray hose attachment bottles of BioAdvance All-in-One Lawn Weed & Crabgrass Killer Ready to Spray in individual plastic bags inside larger plastic bag inside repack box. All 4 bottles on their sides and facing different directions. One bottle had a misthreaded/loose cap and spilled all liquid into the box. Tracking showed box was repacked at Origin Station before images of original packaging could be taken. Unable to determine if shipper had Limited Quantity Diamond and directional arrows. Repack had no markings, Limited Quantity Diamond, or directional arrows to indicate correct orientation to keep liquids upright. DescribePack: Lid on one bottle was misthreaded and loose causing it to spill all liquid into the box after it had been repacked on its side in a box with no markings indicating liquid contents. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Driver isolated the box from other packages and brought back to station for inspection

item.title: Report E-2022090397
item.description:
Report E-2022090397

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-08T21:09:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-30
  • City: ORLANDO
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0917 ET, XPO Logistics terminal NOF reported a spill that occurred inside a trailer in Orlando, FL. The spill consisted of (1) 55 gallon metal drum of UN3082 "Chiguard 353", which was damaged due to not being properly secured and was punctured by a piece of metal inside the trailer as there is a large slit down the side of the drum. ERTS dispatched AOTC to conduct cleanup. At 1052 ET, AOTC arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 30 gallons of product released to an 8' x 20' area of the trailer floor, and a 10' x 12' area of the concrete lot below the trailer. Absorbents were worked into the impacted areas and collected. The damaged drum was containerized into an 85 gallon metal drum. All spent absorbents and cleanup debris was collected and placed into (3) 55 gallon metal drums. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: I was working by the IC belt when a package handler threw the HazMat side-ways onto the blue cart and then threw another (non-HazMat) box on top. It started to leak immediately after. I removed it and informed him about proper loading (including orientation arrows), but he seemed unconcerned. I then told the belt manager and our Safety Specialist. DescribePack: The side and top were wet. Cap was coming off and the seal was broken. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Box was removed from the blue cart and placed inside a red tote along with a HazMat bag. It was placed inside the HazMat Cage.

item.title: Report I-2022090371
item.description:
Report I-2022090371

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-08T21:09:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-18
  • City: Fort Lauderdale
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: BULK TRUCK ROUTE FROM MEMPHIS TO FORT LAUDERDALE FL ARRIVED AND UPON INSPECTION OF TRAILER A GOLDEN LIQUID WAS DISCOVERED SPILLED SURROUNDING MOST OF THE DG PACKAGES. THE DENTED DRUM INDICATED THE SPILL RESULTED FROM DG DRUM NOT BEING PROPERLY LOADED OR BLOCKED AND BRACED FOR TRAVEL AND HAVING DAMAGED ITS SIDE. THE CONTENTS SPILLED FROM A 5GAL BLACK DRUM WITH A NON-REMOVABLE TOP AND APPEARED TO HAVE BEEN ROLLING BACK AND FORTH IN THE TRUCK DURING TRANSIT. THE SPILL HAD A VERY STRONG ODOR AND WAS IDENTIFIED AS A LIQUID CORROSIVE/TOXIC MATERIAL (PAINT THINNER) UN2922. THE SPILL CLEANING TOOK APPROX 2HRS TO FULLY CLEAN AND REMOVE ALL DG FROM TRAILER. REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A STEEL SALVAGE DRUM AND SHIPPER CONTACTED FOR DISPOSITION IF PACKAGE.

  • Description: On 7-5-22 at 0700 personnel in the CSXT Goulding Yard discovered MULX135678, a residue tank car of Dimethylamine, Anhydrous leaking from the top of the tank car. The car was isolated and Polychemie Inc were notified (CHEMTREC Report #2022070500053). E3 Environmental, a CSXT response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found that vapors were being released from both liquid line valves and vapor line valves. All three valves were not in the closed position and all three secondary closure plugs were found to be less than tool tight. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper Stacy Hamlin at 912-432-5220. Contractor personnel closed all the valves and properly tool tightened all three secondary closure plugs. The leak was secured and the car will require an OTMA 1 to be sent to home shop for inspection of valves and closures. This incident did require a special switching move. Tank car had to be placed into a shop track until OTMA 1 is approved for movement to home shop.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: ON JULY 20, AT 1525 SORT CENTER IN MIA RECEIVED A BADLY DAMAGED PACKAGE THAT UPON INSPECTION CONTAINED AEROSOL CANS. THERE WERE NO MARKINGS OR LABELS ON THE OUTSIDE OF THE PACKAGE INDICATING THAT IT CONTAINED DANGEROUS GOODS. THE SPECIALIST OPENED THE PACKAGE AND DISCOVERED 20-25 CANS OF AN AEROSOL SPRAY WITH TWO OF THE CANS OF AEROSOL SPRAY WITH TWO OF THE CANS BEING FULLY DISCHARGED. DG ADMIN INSTRUCTED THE SPECIALIST TO PLACE THIS BOX IN ANOTHER LARGER BOX AND HOLD FOR FURTHER DISPOSITION.

item.description:
Report I-2022100243

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-08T21:09:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-12
  • City: Miami
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: This shipment was opened by FedEx Security. Inside were several devices containing lithium ion batteries (cell phones, Ipads, laptops). The batteries were in the devices. The shipment was not offered with the Lithium Battery Mark. It is undeclared/hidden dangerous goods of UN 3481, Lithium Ion Batteries Contained in Equipment. This was a two-piece shipment but only one package was questioned and held. The other package had continued in the FedEx Express network. As the shipper had not offered this with any DG markings to indicate section II dangerous goods, it is undeclared/hidden DG. The FAA was notified via email and photos sent. The package was held pending FAA investigation until they released it.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: On 07/13/2022 at approximately 02:00, a unit load device was on the ramp in preparation to be loaded to a cargo plane when a forklift moving the unit load device accidentally put the forks through the unit load device. A package containing lithium ion batteries contained in equipment was struck by a forklift fork, damaging the outer package and its inner contents. The package started smoking and emergency personnel was dispatched to respond to incident. This incident occurred at the DHL MIA Hub, 15815 NW 18th Street, Bldg 716J, Miami, FL 33126. Transportation by air has been confirmed.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A shipment was found in a container during the unloading process at the Orlando ramp. The outer fiberboard box looked as if it had been wet at one point. While investigating the shipment it was discovered that one of the eight bottles inside had a loose cap. The bottles were packaged with packing peanuts and each bottle was wrapped in absorbent material sealed inside of individual bags. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper was contacted for an amended shippers declaration.

  • City: Cocoa

  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During the PM sort operations at the FedEx Express sort facility in Cocoa, FL a fiberboard box was observed to potentially contain undeclared dangerous goods. Further investigation indicated the box contain SeamGrip, which per the associated SDS is fully regulated as UN1133 Adhesives PG II. None of the inner contents leaked out. There were no dangerous goods markings or labels on the packaging, and no Shippers Declaration for Dangerous Goods was offered with the shipment. Following spill cleanup, the involved package was placed inside of a salvage drum and help pending further disposition instructions.

  • City: MIAMI

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO FOUR PACKAGES WHERE EACH CONSISTED OF TWO BOXES BEING TAPED TOGETHER. ONLY ONE SET OF THE TAPED PACKAGES HAD A NEXT DAY AIR SAVER THERMAL LABEL AFFIXED TO THE BOX. THE OTHER PACKAGES WERE MISSING THE THERMAL LABELS. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED EACH INDIVIDUAL BOX TO CONTAIN (2) 16 OUNCE CYLINDERS OF COLEMAN PROPANE CAMPING GAS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES. THE PACKAGES WERE OFFERED TO UPS PACKAGED IN USPS PRIORITY MAIL MEDIUM FLAT RATE BOXES. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report I-2022090377
item.description:
Report I-2022090377

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-08T21:09:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-06-08
  • City: Bartow
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FREEHOLD CARTAGE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The carrier(Freehold Cartage, Inc, Transporter No. 2) received the loaded& sealed box trailer from Transporter No. 1, then transported the load to the Freehold Cartage, Inc. 10 Day Storage/ Transfer Facility in Bartow, FL. Upon arrival at the Transfer Facility it was discovered that some of the 1 gallon plastic containers that were shipped in cubic yard boxes had been crushed by unknown materials that had previously been stored on top of the cubic yard boxes. Approximately 15 of the top jugs had been crushed and had split open, allowing approximately 15 gallons of the material to spill onto the floor of the trailer where it had been contained by an internal secondary containment system. Some of this material spilled onto a concrete floor when the trailer doors were opened to examine the load. At that time, an on-call cleanup contractor was brought in to assess, contain, and clean up the interior of the trailer, re-package the damaged containers and clean the affected concrete floor area. All spilled material and absorbents used were packaged in approved 55 gallon steel drums for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2022060687
item.description:
Report X-2022060687

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-08T21:09:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-06-27
  • City: COCOA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDEX GROUND PACKAGE SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: After delivery exception, delivery driver left package on his truck instead of dropping off with QA for VSA processing. Package was unloaded onto the conveyer instead of NC carts and was found leaking in Tower 1 chute. Unable to determine if package was damaged before it went onto the conveyer or not. 4 1gal bottles of EcoLab EcoTemp Phase1 Detergent in product box was found with one side of the box wet and crystalized chemicals on another side. One bottle showed signs of leaking from the cap, but the cap was not loose when tested. DescribePack: at least 1 bottle showed signs of leaking from the cap with noticable volume, but cap was not loose when tested. 1 other bottle had crystalized chemicals near the cap but did not appear to have lost any volume. Possible leakage from package being on its side or high temps in the delivery truck and putting too much pressure on the cap causing a slow leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA notified by tower package handlers that a Hazmat had been sent up the conveyer so it could be pulled out of the chute before it spilled onto other packages.

There were no partitions or any other material to protect the plastic bottles. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. placed in Hazmat cage awaiting instructions from PGH.

item.description:
Report E-2022060130

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-08T21:09:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-05-11
  • City: DORAL
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DHL GLOBAL FORWARDING
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 11, 2022, DHL notified ERTS of a small leak from the middle of a trailer. ERTS dispatched Leah Watts Risk Management to confirm released product and perform clean up. The contractor confirmed the release was only inside the trailer and did not impact the ground beneath or any other mediums. It was confirmed the product released was Axionlimissimo (UN1169 Extracts aromatic,liquid). The contractor advised the drum had a JB Weld material on the bottom indicating there was a prior leak and a repair was attempted. That is where the leak occurred. The contractor overpacked the drum and absorbent used to clean up the impacted area in to a 85-gallon drum.

ACT personnel overpacked the damaged drum and utilized absorbents to remediate the impacted surface.
